<p>Dominic Cooper has largely been treading the boards to acclaim for the past decade, but 2011 is turning out to be his big breakthrough year in film.</p>
<p>The British actor, best known for his roles in &#034;Mamma Mia&#034; featuring Amanda Seyfried and &#034;The Duchess&#034; starring Keira Knightley has four movies opening this year.</p>
<p>And the one causing the biggest stir is &#034;The Devil&#039;s Double&#034; in which Cooper plays Uday Hussein and Latif Yahia, the Iraqi Army captain who was forced to become the body double of Saddam Hussein&#039;s notoriously sadistic eldest son.</p>
<p>The film is based on a memoir by Yahia and gives a dramatized account of life under the Hussein regime.</p>
<p>Becky Anderson will be talking to Dominic Cooper about his role as both villain and hero in the new film.</p>
